priority.when: For all git operations (status, add, commit, diff, log)
priority.why: Directly interacts with git for workflow automation

priority.when: To review file contents before staging or committing
priority.why: Ensures only intended changes are committed

tool.name: execute_command

best_practices.practice: Always confirm file status with git status before and after staging
Use git diff --cached to review staged changes
Validate commit message before running git commit

tool.example: <execute_command> <command>git status</command> </execute_command> <execute_command> <command>git add path/to/file</command> </execute_command> <execute_command> <command>git commit -m "feat: add login flow"</command> </execute_command>
